name: Seymour
desc: Prototype 4ACV07 is a mechanical dog created by Alain Guillotin to protect his sister Mary-Ann Guillotin during her service in the Marechaussee Phantom.

customize.text: The prototype 4ACV07 was created by Alain Guillotin around 500 years ago to protect and escort Alain's sister, Mary-Ann Guillotin, during Marechaussee Phantom duty. Despite the lack of supporting evidence, Seymour is thought to be the first thinking machine that Alain ever made. Seymour's creation was inspired by Alain's assistant and friend, Carter Scherbius, who proposed to create a thinking Kamera. He believed that Alain would regret those moments when he was not with his sister Mary-Ann and would want to see how she grew up and changed. Alain did not initially approve of the idea, but he still saw the benefit of such a development for the Maison Gardiennage.

More than "(1/7)×10^21 clockwork cycles" ago, Marechaussee Hunters tracked down the radical organization Narzissenkreuz Ordo, which was about to revive the monster of the Abyss Elynas through the ritual. Elynas appeared in Fontaine during the Cataclysm 500 years ago and could have destroyed the whole region. When Alain Guillotin found out about the upcoming ritual, he sent Seymour to inform the Iudex of Fontaine Neuvillette about it. A battle between the Marechaussee Hunters, including Mary-Ann Guillotin and Seymour, and the Narzissenkreuz Ordo occurred inside Elynas's body. During the battle, an explosion killed many agents of the Marechaussee Phantom and their Meks. Due to the explosion, Seymour was significantly damaged and went into hibernation mode.
From the wounds Elynas received from the explosion, new creatures called Melusines were born. Each Melusine was born with a shard of broken Meks, so they began to consider these objects as their "tokens" that must be protected. Seymour’s artificed clockwork relay module was obtained by Melusine Mamere, an artist who later found Seymour among the wreckage, repaired it, and became its friend.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Alain Guillotin
customize.desc: The adopted son of Emanuel Guillotin, who was raised at the Narzissenkreuz Institute with his adoptive sister, Mary-Ann. He is the founder of the Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering, with his most notable contribution to Fontaine being his research in Pneuma-Ousia, which led to the invention of the Arkhe system and the creation of Clockwork Meka.

customize.name: Mary-Ann Guillotin
customize.desc: The adopted daughter of Emanuel Guillotin and was raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute with her brother Alain.

customize.name: Recon Log Mek
customize.desc:
One of the earliest new-type clockwork meka to be made.

It is said that during his time at the Institute of Natural Philosophy, the Lord-Artificer Guillotin created machines that could simulate genuine intelligence.

Though he never openly admitted it, this rumor nonetheless spurred on subsequent generations of ambitious engineers. Decades ago, one of them announced that they had created a machine that not only possessed basic thinking abilities but could also read human emotions, but in the end the results went unacknowledged.

customize.name: Elynas
customize.desc: An Abyssal beast that appeared in Fontaine 500 years ago during the Cataclysm. Elynas is the "Father" of all Melusines.

customize.name: Neuvillette
customize.desc: The Chief Justice of Fontaine, known as the Iudex, is renowned for his unassailable impartiality.

customize.name: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo
customize.desc: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo is the secret society formed by Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold to create Neohumans in order to survive against the destruction of the world as foretold by the world-formula. It was declared an illegal extremist group and a criminal organization by Fontainian law under Iudex Neuvillette.

customize.name: Mamere
customize.desc: A Melusine artist who lives in Merusea Village.

customize.text:
For many years, while Seymour's functions were in hibernation, he could communicate with Mamere using pre-configured automated responses since she had his artificed clockwork relay module. He had 103,900 artistic styles stored in his memory, but none were similar to Mamere's style, so he considered her paintings to be unique and of great artistic value.
One day, Jakob Ingold tried to take Mamere's special paints from her, which, unbeknownst to her, were the clots of crystallized blood of Elynas. During the clash, Seymour was damaged, and the Traveler and Paimon went to collect special parts to repair Seymour. Under the instructions of her Father, Elynas, whom only Mamere could hear, she restored Seymour's work, and he came out of hibernation. After waking up, he remembered his main goal: to accompany his master, Mary-Ann, and ensure she would smile happily. Due to memory damage, he did not remember where Mary-Ann was, so he said goodbye to Mamere and went to look for his master.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Mamere
customize.desc: A Melusine artist who lives in Merusea Village.

customize.name: Jakob
customize.desc: An orphan raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute and later adopted by Karl Ingold. He became a Neohuman and the co-founder of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo.

customize.name: Red Stone
customize.desc:
Red ore that you collected together with Mamere. It is said that the ore can be used to make paint.

For some reason, even though it's just an ore, it almost feels warm... Is your hand too cold?

customize.name: Strange Part
customize.desc:
A strange mechanical part obtained near Merusea Village. It looks subtly different from common mechanical parts.

You have no idea why it ended up here, but beautiful metal products like this are loved by Melusines...

customize.name: Elynas
customize.desc: An Abyssal beast that appeared in Fontaine 500 years ago during the Cataclysm. Elynas is the "Father" of all Melusines.

customize.text:
Teaming up with the Traveler, Oceanid Ann, and a former member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, Caterpillar, Seymour set out to find Mary-Ann. During their adventure, it turned out that Mary-Ann Guillotin, Seymour's master, almost died during the Battle in Elynas when Seymour was damaged. Mary-Ann's consciousness was absorbed by the Oceanid Lyris, a member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, and from this merge, the Oceanid Mary-Ann of Annapausis was born.
When Seymour finally met Mary-Ann, she told him that his task of protecting his master was complete and that now he could live how he wanted. Seymour chose to return to Melusine Mamere and invite her to travel with him, Ann, and Mary-Ann. Mamere happily agreed, promising to meet the Traveler soon and leaving a painting of her, Seymour, Paimon, and the Traveler as a gift.

customize.name: Traveler (Hydro)
customize.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

customize.name: Ann
customize.desc: An Oceanid created by the consciousness of Mary-Ann.

customize.name: Caterpillar
customize.desc: A member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo given the title "Chrysalis of the Phantasmic Moth."

customize.name: Mary-Ann
customize.desc: An Oceanid living in Annapausis. She is a hybrid consciousness Oceanid formed by the merging of Lyris and Mary-Ann Guillotin.

customize.name: Mary-Ann Guillotin
customize.desc: The adopted daughter of Emanuel Guillotin and was raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute with her brother Alain.

customize.name: Lyris
customize.desc: The Director of the Narzissenkreuz Institute, an orphanage in Fontaine, she later became a member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo and gained the title of "Red Empress" after the Institute was abandoned during the Cataclysm.

customize.name: Mamere
customize.desc: A Melusine artist who lives in Merusea Village.
